info.title: Planner
info.description: Microsoft Planner lets you easily bring together teams, tasks, documents, and conversations for better results.

percentComplete.description: The completion percentage of the task.

startDateTime.description: The start datetime of the task.

createdDateTime.description: The datetime the task was created.

dueDateTime.description: The datetime the task is due.

hasDescription.description: Set to true if the task has a description.

completedDateTime.description: The datetime the task was completed.

referenceCount.description: The number of external references that exist on the task.

priority.description: Priority of the task. Valid range of values is between 0 and 10 (inclusive), with increasing value being lower priority (0 has the highest priority and 10 has the lowest priority). Currently, Planner interprets values 0 and 1 as "urgent", 2 and 3 and 4 as "important", 5, 6, and 7 as "medium", and 8, 9, and 10 as "low". Currently, Planner sets the value 1 for "urgent", 3 for "important", 5 for "medium", and 9 for "low".

userId.description: The id of the user to whom this task was assigned to.

id.description: The id of the user who assigned this task.

assignedDateTime.description: The datetime the task was assigned.

bucketId.description: The bucket to place this task in.

priority.description: Priority of the task. Valid range of values is between 0 and 10 (inclusive), with increasing value being lower priority (0 has the highest priority and 10 has the lowest priority). Currently, Planner interprets values 0 and 1 as "urgent", 2 and 3 and 4 as "important", 5, 6, and 7 as "medium", and 8, 9, and 10 as "low". Currently, Planner sets the value 1 for "urgent", 3 for "important", 5 for "medium", and 9 for "low".
